intro: Oxydectes thurifera, commonly known as the sweet-scented orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that emit a sweet, intoxicating aroma. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often pollinated by nocturnal insects such as moths.
